thesis.description: While nickel is very widely distributed in nature, occurring as an essential or an accessory constitutent of numerous minerals, known workable deposits of the metal are confined to fewer localities than are those of the more common metals. As a constitutent of the solid crust of the earth, nickel occurs in greater quantity than copper, zinc or lead, but this fact would scarcely be credited from a consideration of the much wider distribution of workable deposits of the latter metals. [...]
thesis.creator: Faith, Willard V.
thesis.subject: Geology & Mineralogy.
thesis.title: Some physical properties of copper-nickel mattes.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The volcanic neck or plug which forms Mount Royal presents a complex history of igneous activity. It comprises a varied and interesting group of rocks of plutonic and hypabyssal types, which penetrate gently dipping Ordovician strata. In common with most of the other Monteregian Hills there were two main intrusions, a basic followed by a more alkaline magma. [...]
thesis.creator: Finley, Frederick L.
thesis.subject: Nepheline syenite.
Geology & Mineralogy.
thesis.title: The nepheline syenites and pegmatites of Mount Royal, Montreal. QUE.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The information obtainable, in the ordinary text book of pathology, on the formation or cause of peritoneal adhesions is very limited. Adami writing on acute fibrinous inflammation of serous surfaces states "There is an abundant migration of the leukocytes out of the surface vessels...." [...]

Peritoneum -- Growth.
Physiology.
thesis.title: Growth-adhesive affinities of different forms of tissue; with special reference to peritoneal adhesions.

thesis.description: The question of the settlement of slimes probably dates as far back as 1907, when the basic patent for a Dorr thickener was first brought out. Though there were a number of articles written upon the settlement of slimes, no quantitative results of any importance were forthcoming until [...]

thesis.subject: Ore Dressing.
thesis.title: Sedimentation of finely divided rock material from water suspension, with especial reference to the theory of design of settling tanks and similar apparatus.

thesis.description: The following investigation was undertaken to determine the factors which induce Injury to seed oats after smut disinfection, and if possible to find remedies for the injury. Different treatments, efficient in oat smut control, have been recommended in the past, but little has been definitely observed regarding the action of such treatments on the germination of the seed. [...]
thesis.creator: Gordon, William L.
thesis.subject: Oats -- Disease and pest resistance.
Smut diseases.
Plant Pathology.
Seeds -- Disinfection.
thesis.title: Studies concerning injury to seed oats after smut disinfection.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In this communication I have selected for discussion and for experiment a few of those factors which in a practical way come to the forefront in performing the Wassermann reaction, and it is my intention to deal with the following conditions: - 1. Antigen in high doses; 2. Fat in the serum; 3. Fat-solvents and haemolysing agents, water, and also tinct. iodi; 4. Overheating of the sera; 5. Old sera and sera infected with bacteria; 6. Complement fixation by precipitates; 7. Action of diarsenol on the serum.
thesis.creator: Green, F.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Some practical points in connection with the Wassermann reaction.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A study of the genitalia of the dried specimens resolves itself into a study of those parts of the genitalia, usually very heavily chitinized, that remain unaltered after the specimen has dried up after death. [...]
thesis.creator: Hammond, George H.
thesis.subject: Entomology.
thesis.title: The genitalia of Graptolitha Hbn. (Cucullinae, Noctuidae).

thesis.description: Drama today in England is in a more flourishing condition than it has been since the days of Goldsmith and Sheridan. The period from 1779, when Sheridan's "Critic" was produced to 1889 when "A Doll's House" was first performed in England, has been called the Dark Age of our dramatic literature. During this hundred years or more the theatres themselves flourished. They subsisted in large part upon the plays of the former great masters, but the work of contemporary dramatists was also produced with success. [...]
thesis.creator: Harris, Richard C.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: The plays and prefaces of George Bernard Shaw: a study of Shaw the dramatist and his criticism and interpretation of life.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The reactions of hydrogen peroxide with the halogens and halogen hydrides has long been known. No work has hitherto been done on the reaction between hydrogen peroxide and hydrochloric acid. This has probably been due to the fact that concentrated solutions of pure hydrogen peroxide have been very difficult to prepare and the opportunities for extensive experimentation have been accordingly limited. [...]
thesis.creator: Hiebert, Paul G.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The physical and chemical properties of pure hydrogen peroxide.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Since the discovery of Hydrogen Peroxide by Thénard in 1817 and his classical researches on both organic and inorganic substances, chemical literature has been replete with details of experiments performed with this common but yet comparatively unknown compound. It is necessary to point out that the effects of acid, alkaline and neutral media on potassium permanganate have been systematised, whereas no such classification has been attempted in the case of hydrogen peroxide. [...]
thesis.creator: Holden, George W.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Hydrogen peroxide as an oxidising agent in acid solution.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The area described in this paper lies between the towns of Campbellton and Dalhousie on the south shore of the Restigouche River, and in the extreme northern portion of the Province of New Brunswick. The attention of geologists has been called tothis region for some years owing to the presence of a rich Devonian fauna in a sedimentary series, interbedded with a number of ash beds and a striking succession of lava flows and intrusive sheets about one mile east of Dalhousie. [...]
thesis.creator: Howard, Waldorf V.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The Devonian volcanic series in the vicinity of Dalhousie, New Brunswick.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the field of physical properties and their relation to chemical structure there has been developed a relatively new idea which deals with the orientation of molecules. In this thesis are considered some inferences which can be drawn from the theory of orientation and the results of experiments made to test the inferences. [...]
thesis.creator: Hunten, Kenneth W.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: On the examination of anomalous values of the Ramsey-Shields surface tension constant.

thesis.description: No less in the case of Canada has the tariff been an important factor in her development, for the worse or for the better according as one is a free-trader or a protectionist. It will be of interest to review not only the effects of the tariff on Canada's external trade and internal development, but as well the motives which have inspired protectionism for the Dominion. [...]
thesis.creator: Jones, Randolph K.
thesis.subject: Economics and Political Science.
thesis.title: Certain aspects of the economic development of the Dominion of Canada, with special reference to trade relations with the United Kingdom and the United States, and to the effects of tariff policies and investments on the expansion of British North America.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Master of Arts
degree.discipline: Department of Economics and Political Science

thesis.description: The first steps toward the advance of the West were taken through the settlement of the Red River District in 1811 by a band of emigrants from the Highlands of Scotland who were brought over by Lord Selkirk, and came by the Hudson's Bay route. They received grants of land amounting to ten million acres centering about Fort Douglas which afterwards was to become Fort Garry and later Winnipeg. [...]
thesis.creator: Kydd, Mary W.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: Alien races in the Canadian West.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Canada there are some 37,000 square miles of Peat Bogs. While some of this will undoubtedly eventually be used for manufacture, the time has not come for large areas to be used in this way. In the meantime are these lands to lie idle, and are the areas unsuited to industrial development to find no place in our Agriculture? Reclaimed peat soils are often quite valuable, particularly for certain crops. In districts near large commercial centers, where land is high priced, the development of new areas more difficult to handle is becoming practicable, and if means of reclaiming these deposits at a reduced cost are discovered, or of increasing their value as a crop producing medium found, a distinct forward step will have been taken. With the object of studying this particular peat, and getting if possible a little light on some of the problems in its reclamation, samples were taken from the deposit lying between the Nicomekl and Serpentine Rivers in Surrey Municipality. [...]
thesis.creator: Lamb, Cecil A.
thesis.subject: Agronomy.
Peat soils.
Burning of land.
Fertilizers.
thesis.title: The effect of burning, liming and manuring on certain peat soils, as measured by plant growth.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The general practice of gold milling in the Porcupine area of northern Ontario is that of the North American continent, and it is usually spoken of as the "all sliming" process. Briefly this process consists in the reduction of the ore to such a fineness that it's precious metal content will be exposed to the action of the extracting solution and this necessitates extremely fine grinding. [...]
thesis.creator: Legg, Roland E.
thesis.subject: Ore Dressing.
thesis.title: The applicability of gravity concentration and flotation as accessory to cyanidation in the treatment of a Porcupine ore.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Most of the work on the preparation of diolefines has been done since 1910, to which point the literature is covered in Beilstein's Handbook, Ditmar's booklet, Harries's book, etc. For that reason, the following more or less complete reference tables on the preparation of isoprene and dimethylbutadiene have been included below. [...]

thesis.title: Work on the chemistry of diolefines.

thesis.description: The object of this work was to find out if possible any new light regarding the function or mechanism of the spleen. At the outset my idea was to perfuse the spleen with a solution of Ringer's, in which were minutely divided foreign particles, and the materials used were insoluble India ink and insoluble Per Red R. imported by McArthur, Brown Company. As these experiments did not yield any information, other aspects were considered, such as intravitam injections, stimulation of the nerves to spleen, sectioning of the nerves and also removal of spleen. All work was performed on dogs and under anaesthesia. [...]
thesis.creator: Malcolm, Robert B.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Some aspects of the physiology of the spleen.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The collection and the study of the folk-lore of the countries of Europe, has occupied the attention of learned ethnologists, historians and literary men for many years, with the result that England, France, Germany, Italy and other countries can boast at the present day of Museums stored with records and documents on the subject, and most of them have their own journals of folk-lore. [...]
thesis.creator: Mathewson, Dorothy R.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: French-Canadian folk songs
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Greater importance is being given to the effect of staggered rivets on the critical section of riveted tension memebers. Such a weakening effect is generally allowed for by a reduction in the transverse net area. As modern specifications provide a great variety of methods for calculating this additional deduction, it is the purpose ofthis paper to compare some of the more representative methods in the light of actual tests. The results used for this comparison are taken from three separate investigations into the strength of builtup tension members. Among these will be found most of the types in common use for heavy oonstruction. [...]
thesis.creator: McLennan, Logan S.
thesis.subject: Theory of Structures.
thesis.title: Net sections in riveted tension members.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the past, physical chemists have directed, a good deal of attention to the study of molecular structure and its relation to physical properties; more recently, attention has been centered on the properties corresponding to the different atomic structures. These two lines of investigation are now considered to be one and the same as the properties of any substance result from the proton-electron arrangement, first in the atoms themselves, and then as atoms in relation to one another in the molecule. [...]
thesis.creator: Morrison, Donald M.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: A study of molecular forces by means of the gas laws, molecular compound formation, and velocities of reaction.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The occurrence of the Monteregian Hills in the vicinity of Montreal, Province of Quebec, has for many years presented an interesting structural and petrographical problem to geologists. This paper is in continuation of the work done by Carlyle, being a description and investigation of further dykes encountered in the western portion of the Canadian National Railways' Tunnel beneath Mt. Royal. [...]

thesis.title: Dykes of the Mt. Royal tunnel from the West Portal to Station 284+99.

thesis.description: While it is agreed that corn is the most desirable silage crop, there is still much controversy as to the proper thickness of planting the corn in order to get the greatest amount of nutrients per acre. The great tendency is to plant the corn very thickly, the growers claiming that in this way they get the most succulent silage and the greatest tonnage per acre. Others plant thinly and claim that a good ear development is necessary if silage of a high nutritive value is to be obtained. [...]
thesis.creator: Parent, Robert C.
thesis.subject: Corn as feed.
Agronomy.
Corn -- Field experiments.
thesis.title: Thickness of planting in corn.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is the intention of the writer to give an account of the present state of a particular phase of the problem involved in the explanation of the production of X-rays by the passage of Cathode or ß-particles through matter, and of a partially completed investigation which has been made in connection with this problem. [...]
thesis.creator: Patterson, Arthur L.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The transformation of electronic energy (cathode and beta-rays) into electromagnetic radiations (X-rays).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: All solids tend to adsorb or to condense upon their surfaces any gases or vapours with which they are in contact. Since porous solids possess an extremely large surface, relative to their mass, one would expect this power to be developed to a high degree, and this is amply borne out by the observed facts. The original discovery of this phenomenon was made by Scheele and Fontana, independently, in 1777, and the selective nature of adsorption was at once recognized. [...]
thesis.creator: Patton, Isabelle J.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The relations existing between the degree of unsaturation of an organic compound and the amount of its adsorption by charcoal.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
